{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3126171,"name":"Clark Hillabrant","username":"Chilly","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/c/e5b9ba/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-01-14T17:13:18.552Z","cooked":"

So the our pdp already has a rio,pneumatic controller, and vrm taking up the six slots it gives you. How can we power out limelight 2 with no slots left. Poe and standard wiring seem to have the same issue.

Solved by using a 20 amp hooked directly to pdp(+ vbat output channel).

20230114_1201591920×2560 466 KB

20230114_1204191920×2560 342 KB

I see a few options.

If a VRM port of the right type is open (NOT the radio port), that would work.

Otherwise, slap a 20A breaker in the open portion of the PDP and connect the Limelight to that.

So vrm is fine even with the limelight docs advising against it.

https://docs.limelightvision.io/en/latest/getting_started.html

If the docs advise against it, then don’t do it.

Now that you’ve read the docs, what do they say to do?

Use one of those 6 open 20a/30a PDP slots. There is plenty of room for custom circuits off those.
The end connectors are for mission critical components-rio, radio rev POE/vrm, PCM/PH.
